article: In the early 1800's, a boy named John lived in an orphanage with several other children. Every day was  _  working and Christmas was the one day of the year  _  the children did not work and received a gift -- an orange. The children valued it so much that they kept it for weeks, and even  _  -- smelling it, touching it and loving it. Usually they tried to kept it for so  _  that it often went bad before they ate it. This year John knew he would soon be  _  enough to leave. He would save the orange until his birthday in July. If he preserved it  _  , he might be able to eat it on his birthday. Christmas day finally came. The children were so  _  as they entered the dining hall. In his excitement, John knocked over something, causing a big  _  . Immediately the master shouted, "John, leave the hall and there will be no orange for you." John's heart  _  . He turned and ran back to the cold room so that the children wouldn't see his tears. Then he heard the door open and the children entered. Little Elizabeth with a  _  on her face held out her small hands. "Here John," she said, "this is for you." As John  _  his head, he saw a big juicy orange all peeled and quartered ....... Each child had sacrificed their own orange by  _  John never forgot the sharing, love and personal sacrifice his friends had shown him that Christmas day.  In memory of  that day, after he became rich, every year he  _  send oranges all over the world to children everywhere. His  _  was that no child would ever spend Christmas without a special Christmas fruit!
